<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 72PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT: -72PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_ITEM7MDA">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT&#x2019;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 72PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT: -72PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Linear Technology Corporation, a member of the S&amp;P 500, has been designing, manufacturing and marketing a broad line of high performance analog integrated circuits for major companies worldwide for over three decades. The Company&#x2019;s products provide an essential bridge between our analog world and the digital electronics in communications, networking, industrial,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	transportation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, computer, medical, instrumentation, consumer, and military and aerospace systems. Linear Technology produces power management, data conversion, signal conditioning, RF and interface ICs, &#xB5;Module
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:120%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	subsystems, and wi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reless sensor network products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_274">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Quarterly revenues of $373.8 million for the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016 increased $12.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or 3.5%,
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_276">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	over the previous quarter's
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_277">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenues of
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_278">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$361.1 million. The Company&#x2019;s quarterly industry leading gross margin and operating margin percentages remained relatively steady at 76.4% and 45.9%
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_279">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	respectively,
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_280">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	while earnings per share increased $0.02 to $0.54.&nbsp;For
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_281">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal year
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_282">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_283">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, revenue decreased 3.5% to $1,423.9 million, while earnings per share decreased $0.10 to $2.02. The Company had three sequential quarters of revenue growth after a significant decline in the first fiscal quarter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of 2016
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_285">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. As a result of the pending Analog Acquisition, the Company will not provide expected financial results for the
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_286">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	first quarter of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_288">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2017 or future periods.
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_289">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_280">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Acquisition by Analog Devices
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On July 26, 2016, the Company announced that it had entered into the Analog Merger Agreement, under which a wholly owned subsidiary of Analog Devices will merge with and into the Company, and the Company will survive as a wholly owned subsidiary of Analog Devices. Under the terms of the Analog Merger Agreement, Linear Technology stockholders who do not exercise their appraisal rights under Delaware law will have the right to receive, for each Linear Technology share held by such
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_291">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stockholders
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, $46.00 as Cash Consideration and 0.2321 shares of Analog Devices common stock as Stock Consideration (with the ratio of Stock Consideration to Cash Consideration subject to adjustment pursuant to the terms of the Analog Merger Agreement so that the aggregate number of shares issued by Analog Devices
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_295">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Stock Consideration will not exceed 19.9% of the total outstanding common stock of Analog Devices prior to the Analog Acquisition). Each of the Company&#x2019;s equity awards that were outstanding as of July 22, 2016 and are unvested as of the closing of the Analog Acquisition will be converted into the right to receive the Merger Consideration in respect of each share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock underlying such award when such award vests.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of the
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_296">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	other equity awards that were granted after July 22, 2016 and are unvested as of the closing of the Analog Acquisition will be converted into the right to receive 0.9947 shares of Analog Devices common stock in respect of each share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock underlying such award when such award vests.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The transaction has been approved by both
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_299">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Board of Directors
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_300">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_301">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	board of directors
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_302">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of Analog Devices
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_303">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the completion of the Analog Acquisition is subject to customary closing conditions including, among others, the approval of Linear Technology&#x2019;s stockholders and various regulatory approvals.
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_4_305">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has incurred, and in the future will continue to incur, significant non-recurring costs in connection with the Analog Acquisition.
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_306">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ability to borrow under the Credit Agreement (as defined below) or other means of obtaining capital may be restricted by the terms of the Analog Merger Agreement. The transaction is expected to close during the first half of calendar 2017. For additional information on the Analog Merger Agreement and the Analog Acquisition, please refer to the Company&#x2019;s Current Report on Form 8-K, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on July 29, 2016. The Company cannot guarantee that the Analog Acquisition will be completed or that, if completed, it will be exactly on the terms as set forth in the Analog Merger Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Should the Analog Acquisition not be completed, the Company will continue to be responsible for payment of commitments to current employees under retention agreements and may either receive or pay a termination fee depending on the circumstances, as provided for in the Analog Merger Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States, which require it to make estimates and judgments that significantly affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities. The Company regularly evaluates these estimates, including those related to inventory valuation, revenue recognition and income taxes. These estimates are based on historical experience and on assumptions that are believed by management to be reasonable under the circumstances. Actual results may differ from these estimates, which may impact the carrying values of assets and liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company believes the following critical accounting policies affect the more significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of the Company&#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company recognizes revenues when the earnings process is complete, when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, the product has been delivered, the price is fixed and determinable and collection is reasonably assured.&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the Company recognized approximately 15% of net revenues from domestic distributors that are recognized under agreements which provide for certain sales price rebates and limited produc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	t return privileges
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given the uncertainties associated with the levels of pricing rebates, the ultimate sales price on domestic distributor sales transactions is not fixed or determinable until domestic distributors sell the merchandise to the end-user.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time of shipment to domestic distributors, the Company records a trade receivable and deferred revenue at the distributor purchasing price since there is a legally enforceable obligation from the distributor to pay for the products delivered.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company relieves inventory as title has passed to the distributor and recognizes deferred cost of sales in the same amount.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Deferred income on shipments to distributors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	represents the difference between deferred revenue and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	deferred cost of sales and is recognized as a current liability until such time as the distributor confirms a final sale to its end customer.&nbsp;&nbsp;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the Company had approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$61.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of deferred revenue and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$12.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of deferred cost of sales recognized as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$48.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Deferred income on shipments to distributors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 28, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the Company had approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$58.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of deferred revenue and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$11.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of deferred cost of sales recognized as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$46.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Deferred income on shipments to distributors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company believes that its deferred costs of revenues have limited risk of material impairment, as the Company offers stock rotation privileg
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	es to distributors (up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5% of quarterly purchases) which enable distributors to rotate slow moving inventory. In addition, stock rotated inventory that is returned to the Company is generally resalable.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reviews distributor ending on-hand inventory balances, as well as orders placed on the Company to ensure that di
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stributors are not overstocking parts and are ordering to forecasted demand. To the extent the Company was to have a significant reduction in distributor price or grant significant price rebates, there could be a material impact on the ultimate revenue and gross profit recognized. During fiscal years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the price rebates that have been remitted back to distributors have ranged from $3.5 million to $4.4 million per quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s sales to international distributors are made under agreements which permit limited stock return privileges but not sales price rebates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue on these sales is recognized upon shipment at which time title passes.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has reserves to cover expected product returns.&nbsp;&nbsp;If product returns for a particular fiscal period exceed or are below expectations, the Company may determine that additional or less sales return allowances are required to properly reflect its estimated exposure for product returns.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, changes to sales return allowances have not had a significant impact on operating margin.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Inventory Valuation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company values inventories at the lower of cost or market.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company records charges to write-down inventories for unsalable, excess or obsolete raw materials, work-in-process and finished goods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Newly introduced parts are generally not valued until success in the market place has been determined by a consistent pattern of sales and backlog among other factors.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company arrives at the estimate for newly released parts by analyzing sales and customer backlog against ending inventory on hand.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reviews the assumptions on a quarterly basis and makes decisions with regard to inventory valuation based on the current business climate.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to write-downs based on newly introduced parts,
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	judgmental assessments are calculated for the remaining inventory based on salability, obsolescence, historical experience and current business conditions.&nbsp;&nbsp;If actual market conditions are less favorable than those projected by management, additional inventory write-downs may be required that could adversely affect operating results. If actual market conditions are more favorable, the Company may have higher gross margins when products are sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales to date of such products have not had a significant impact on gross margin.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company must make certain estimates and judgments in determining income tax expense for financial statement purposes. These estimates and judgments occur in the calculation of tax credits, tax benefits and deductions and in the calculation of certain tax assets and liabilities, which arise from differences in the timing of recognition of revenue and expense for tax and financial statement purposes. Significant changes to these estimates may result in an increase or decrease to the tax provision in a subsequent period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The calculation of the Company&#x2019;s tax liabilities involves uncertainties in the application of complex tax regulations. The Company recognizes liabilities for uncertain tax positions based on the two-step process prescribed in the authoritative accounting literature. The first step is to evaluate the tax position for recognition by determining if the weight of available evidence indicates that it is more likely than not that the position will be sustained on audit, including resolution of related appeals or litigation processes, if any. The second step requires the Company to estimate and measure the tax benefit as the largest amount that is more than 50% likely to be realized upon ultimate settlement. It is inherently difficult and subjective to estimate such amounts, as the Company has to determine the probability of various possible outcomes.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reevaluates these uncertain tax positions on a quarterly basis. This evaluation is based on factors in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cluding, but not limited to, changes in facts or circumstances, changes in tax law, effectively settled issues under audit, and new audit activity. Such a change in recognition or measurement would result in the recognition of a tax benefit or an additional charge to the tax provision.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Refer to Note 10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of Notes to Consolidated Financial Stat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ements of this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Form 10-K for a discussion of current tax matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	32
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The table below presents the income statement items
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expressed as a percentage of revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the periods indicated.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:38.56%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_10"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="8" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.02%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.5PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal Year Ended
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	declined in all ma
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	jor geographies compared to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Rest of World geography is primarily Asia, excluding Japan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Revenue declined in all end-markets, except Transportation, with Industrial, Communication, and Computer showing the largest declines in absolute dollars.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s bookings in the Industrial,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Transportation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, Communication infrastructure, and Military end-markets in aggregate were 90% of bookings in fiscal year 2016, as compared to 88% of bookings for fiscal year 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Revenues in fiscal year 2016 decreased from the prior fiscal year due to decreases in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	number of units shipped, partially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offset by a higher average selling price (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ASP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	). The number of units shipped in fiscal year 2016 decreased 7% to 732.7 million units from 785.3 million units in fiscal year 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The ASP in fiscal year 2016 increased 3% to $1.95 per unit over $1.89 per unit in fiscal year 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Communication infrastructure, and Military end-markets in aggregate were 88% of bookings in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Revenues in fiscal year 2015 increased over the prior fiscal year due to&nbsp;increases&nbsp;in the number of units shipped and&nbsp;in&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the ASP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of units. The number of units shipped in fiscal year 2015 increased 4% to 785.3 million units over 753.8&nbsp;million units in&nbsp;fiscal year 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The ASP in fiscal year 2015 increased&nbsp;3%&nbsp;to $1.89 per unit over $1.84&nbsp;per unit in&nbsp;fiscal year 2014.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9.35PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.22%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">

</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	margin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the prior fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was 75.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	G
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ross margin in fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	benefited from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a higher ASP, higher factory efficiencies, and favorable foreign exchange rates,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	partially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	spreading
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fixed costs over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	low
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	er
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenue base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Gross margin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for fiscal year 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	75.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	75.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The increase in gross margin in fiscal year 2015 was primarily due to spreading fixed costs over a higher
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	revenue base and a higher ASP, partially offset by higher labor, raw material, and electronic component costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9.35PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFF00;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9.35PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Research and Development (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	)
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal year 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$9.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to a $5.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million increase in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	labor and fringe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compensation costs as a result of increases in headcount,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	merit increases, and the extra week during fiscal year 2016 as the period had 53 weeks compared to the customary 52 weeks.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	employee stock-based compensation costs increased $4.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, partially due to the extra week during fiscal year 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and other R&amp;D expense increased $1.7 million primarily due
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to higher expenses for R&amp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	supplies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These increases were partially offset by a $2.1 million decrease in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	employee profit sharing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lower operating income during fiscal year 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal year 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&amp;D expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$16.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	an $8.1 million increase in compensation costs as a result of increases in headcount, annual salar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ies,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and related fringe benefit costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, employee profit sharing increased $3.5 million and employee stock-based compensation costs increased $4.0 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal year 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	SG&amp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to a $2.0 million increase in stock-based compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, partially due to the extra week during fiscal year 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million increase in compensation costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mainly as a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	merit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increases and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related fringe benefit costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	partially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offset by a $0.3 million decrease from lower commission costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. These increases were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	partially offset by a $1.0 million decrease in employee profit sharing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as a result of lower operating income during fiscal year 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a $1.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	decrease in other SG&amp;A expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to lower expenses from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	advertising and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	travel.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal year 2015 SG&amp;A expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$10.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	primarily due to a $2.1 million increase in compensation costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	mainly as a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	annual salary increases and commission costs. In addition, employee profit sharing increased $2.8 million and employee stock-based compensation increased $2.2 million.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Other SG&amp;A expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	increased $3.3 million primarily due to advertising and legal expenses.
</FONT>
</P>

	&#xFEFF;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.30%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9.35PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Fiscal year 2016 interest and other income increased $3.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year, primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	due to an increase in the average cash balance and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	higher
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	interest rates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	earned on the Company's cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities balances.&nbsp;In addition, the prior fiscal year was lower
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	due to&nbsp;higher foreign currency exchange losses&nbsp;on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	non-trade foreign receivables.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Fiscal year 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	interest expense decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	$41.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	compared to the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	as a result of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	conversion of the Company&#x2019;s 3.00% Convertible Senior Notes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	(the &#x201C;Notes&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	at the end of the fiscal year 2014. Fiscal year 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	interest and other income was $2.7 million and remained flat with the interest and other income of $2.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	million in fisca
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	l year 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The average interest rate earned increased during fiscal year 2015; however, interest income was unchanged due to lower cash, cash equivalents and marketable security balances as a result of the debt extinguishment of the Notes and marginally due to higher foreign currency exchange losses on non-trade foreign receivables.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9.35PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

	The Company&#x2019;s effective tax rate is lower than the federal statutory rate of 35% as a result of lower tax rates on the earnings of its wholly-owned foreign subsidiaries, principally in Singapore and Malaysia.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has a partial tax holiday in Singapore through August 2019 and a par

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company&#x2019;s international operations and capital requirements are funded primarily by cash generated by foreign operating activities and cash held by non-U.S subsidiaries. The Company&#x2019;s U.S. operations and capital requirements are funded primarily by cash generated from U.S. operating activities and to a lesser extent by cash and investments held by the U.S. parent company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash generated by U.S. operations has been and is expected to be sufficient to meet the Company&#x2019;s business needs in the U.S. for the foreseeable future including the funding of U.S. operations, purchases of capital equipment and the quarterly dividend.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e to an increase in the Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reserve balances for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	work in process
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s net property, plant and equipment balance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$285.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at the end of fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	creased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the prior year balance. Fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	asset additions totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$47.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	primarily&nbsp;for&nbsp;procurement of assembly, test and wafer fabrication equipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and the extension of a factory building in Singapore.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation expense was&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$49.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million during fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A cash dividend of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share dividend will be paid on August 2

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6

	to stockholders of record on August 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2

	, 201

	6

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The payment of future dividends will be based on financial performance.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On October 23, 2013, the Company entered into a $100.0 million credit agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Wells Fargo Bank, National Association (the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Credit Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	originally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	entered into the Credit Agreement to enhance cash deployment flexibility in connection with the conversion of its Notes and potential
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	onshore cash requirements post-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	conversion.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On July 27, 2015, the Credit Agreement was amended to increase the size of the line of credit to $150.0 million and to extend the maturity date from October 23, 2015 t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	o July 27, 2017.
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_308">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Pursuant to the terms of the Linear Merger Agreement, the Company&#x2019;s ability to borrow under the Credit Agreement cannot exceed $75 million without Analog Devices&#x2019; consent.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has not utilized the Credit Agreement to date. For further information on the Credit Agreement, see Note 7 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Under the Analog Merger Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	must pay Analog Devices a termination fee of $490 million if the merger agreement is terminated in certain circumstances involving a company takeover proposal, an adverse recommendation change or a breach of the Company&#x2019;s non-solicitation obligations under the Analog Merger Agreement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Conversely,&nbsp;Analog Devices has agreed to pay a termination fee of $700 million to the Company&nbsp;if the Analog Merger Agreement is terminated under
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	36
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	certain circumstances involving the failure to obtain required regulatory approvals.&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

</FONT>

	Company has not utilized the Credit Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	to date

	ITEM 7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Interest rate risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company&#x2019;s cash equivalents and marketable securities are subject to market risk, primarily interest rate and credit risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s investments are managed by outside professional managers within investment guidelines set by the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such guidelines include security type, credit quality and maturity and are intended to limit market risk by restricting the Company&#x2019;s investments to high quality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	debt instruments with relatively short-term maturities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based upon the weighted average duration of the Company&#x2019;s investments at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, a hypothetical 100 basis point increase in short-term interest rates would result in an unrealized loss in market value of the Company&#x2019;s investments tot
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	aling approximately $8.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	million.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Such losses would only be realized if the Company sold the investments prior to maturity.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	These investments are reported at fair
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	value with the related unrealized gains or losses reported in accumulated other comprehensive income, a component of stockholders&#x2019; deficit. The Company generally holds securities until maturity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Foreign exchange risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company&#x2019;s sales outside the United States are transacted in U.S. dollars; accordingly, the Company&#x2019;s sales are not generally impacted by foreign currency rate changes. The operations outside of the United States incur operating expenses denominated in foreign currencies. The results of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	operations and cash flows are therefore
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	subject to fluctuations due to changes in foreign currency exchange rates. The Company has not entered into any foreign currency exchange contracts to hedge foreign exchange risk.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	37
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The FASB issued ASU 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, which simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes. This ASU requires that deferred tax assets and liabilities be classified as non-current. During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016 the standard was early adopted on a prospective basis. Adoption of this ASU resulted in a reclassification of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$49.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	million of current deferred tax assets to net non-current deferred tax liabilities in the Consolidated Balance Sheet as of July 3, 2016. No prior periods were retrospectively adjusted.
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.98%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	LINEAR TECHNOLOGY CORPORATION
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_NOTESTOCONSOLIDATEDFINANCIALSTATEMENTS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Description of Business and Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Description of Business
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Linear Technology Corporation (together with its consolidated subsidiaries,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Linear,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Linear Technology
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	), a member of the S&amp;P 500, has been designing, manufacturing and marketing a broad line of high performance analog integrated circuits for major companies worldwide for over three decades. The Company&#x2019;s products provide an essential bridge between our analog world and the digital electronics in communications, networking, industrial,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	transportation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, computer, medical, instrumentation, consumer, and military and aerospace systems. Linear Technology produces power management, data conversion, signal conditioning, RF and interface ICs, &#xB5;Module
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:120%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	subsystems, and wireless sensor network products.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is a Delaware corporation; it was originally organized and incorporated in California in 1981.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Basis of Presentation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company operates on a 52/53-week fiscal year ending on the Sunday nearest June 30.&nbsp;Fiscal years&nbsp;2015 and 2014 were 52-week years.&nbsp;Fiscal year 2016 is a 53-week fiscal year, with the additional week falling in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	second
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly-owned subsidiaries after elimination of all significant inter-company accounts and transactions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accounts denominated in foreign currencies have been remeasured using the U.S. dollar as the functional currency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The preparation of financial statements and related disclosures in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States requires management to make estimates and judgments that affect the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Actual results could differ materially from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Pending Acquisition by Analog Devices, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On July 26, 2016, the Company announced that it had entered into a definitive merger agreement (the &#x201C;Analog Merger Agreement&#x201D;) with Analog Devices, Inc. (&#x201C;Analog Devices&#x201D;), under which a wholly owned subsidiary of Analog Devices will merge with and into the Company, and the Company will survive as a wholly owned subsidiary of Analog Devices (the &#x201C;Analog Acquisition&#x201D;). Under the terms of the Analog Merger Agreement, Linear Technology stockholders who do not exercise their appraisal rights under Delaware law will have the right to receive, for each Linear Technology share held by such
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_413">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	stockholders
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$46.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in cash (the &#x201C;Cash Consideration&#x201D;) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.2321
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of Analog Devices common stock, par value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.16 2/3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share (the &#x201C;Stock Consideration,&#x201D; and together with the Cash Consideration, the &#x201C;Merger Consideration&#x201D;) (with the ratio of Stock Consideration to Cash Consideration to be adjusted pursuant to the terms of the Analog Merger Agreement so that the aggregate number of shares issued by Analog Devices
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_415">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Stock Consideration will not exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	19.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the total outstanding common stock of Analog Devices prior to the Analog Acquisition). Each of the Company&#x2019;s equity awards that were outstanding as of July 22, 2016 and are unvested as of the closing will be converted into the right to receive the Merger Consideration in respect of each share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock underlying such award when such award vests.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of the
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_416">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	other equity awards that were granted after July 22, 2016 and are unvested as of the closing will be converted into the right to receive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.9947
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of Analog Devices common stock in respect of each share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock underlying such award when such award vests.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Analog Merger Agreement includes representations, warranties and covenants, including break-up fees payable or receivable under certain circumstances if the transaction fails to close.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_417">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The transaction has been approved by both
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_419">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Board of Directors
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_420">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the board of directors of Analog Devices,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the completion of the Analog Acquisition is subject to customary closing conditions including, among others, the approval of Linear Technology&#x2019;s stockholders and various regulatory approvals. The transaction is expected to close during the first half of calendar 2017. For additional information on the Analog Merger Agreement and the Analog Acquisition, please refer
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
