<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the Company&#x2019;s Current Report on Form 8-K, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on July 29, 2016. The Company cannot guarantee that the Analog Acquisition will be completed or that, if completed, it will be exactly on the terms set forth in the Analog Merger Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cash Equivalents and Marketable Securities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Cash equivalents are highly liquid investments purchased with original maturities of three months or less at the time of purchase.&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash equivalents consist of investment grade securities in commercial paper, bank certificates of deposit, and money market funds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Investments with maturities over three months at the time of purchase are classified as marketable securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;At July 3, 2016 and June 28, 2015, the Company&#x2019;s marketable securities balance consisted primarily of debt securities in municipal bonds, corporate bonds, commercial paper, U.S. and foreign government and agency securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s marketable securities are managed by outside professional managers within investment guidelines set by the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s investment guidelines generally restrict the professional managers to high quality debt instruments with a credit rating of AAA.&nbsp;&nbsp; Within the Company&#x2019;s investment policy there is a provision that allows the Company to hold AA+ securities under certain circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s investments in debt securities are classified as available-for-sale.&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments in available-for-sale securities are reported at fair value with unrealized gains and losses, net of tax, as a component of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accumulated other comprehensive income (loss)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, net of tax&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company classifies investments with maturities greater than twelve months as current as it considers all investments as a potential source of operating cash regardless of maturity date.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cost of securities matured or sold is based on the specific identification method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The allowance for doubtful accounts reflects the Company&#x2019;s best estimate of probable losses inherent in the accounts receivable balance. The Company determines the allowance based on the aging of its accounts receivable, historical experience, known troubled accounts, management judgment and other currently available evidence.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company writes off accounts receivable against the allowance when it determines a balance is uncollectible and no longer actively pursues collection of the receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Concentrations of Credit Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to concentrations of credit risk consist primarily of cash equivalents, marketable securities, and accounts receivable. The Company&#x2019;s investment policy restricts investments to high credit quality investments with maturities of three years or less and limits the amount invested with any one issuer.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounts receivable from significant customers, those representing&nbsp;10%&nbsp;or mor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e of total accounts receivable included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	approximately&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	42%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;of the a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ccounts receivable balance from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the Company&#x2019;s largest distributor,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Arrow,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of July 3, 2016, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	36%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of June 28, 2015. Concentrations of credit risk with respect to accounts receivable are generally not significant due to the diversity of the Company&#x2019;s customers, customer end-markets, and customer geographical locations.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company performs ongoing credit evaluations of its customers&#x2019; financial condition and requires collateral, primarily letters of credit, as deemed necessary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s assets, liabilities and cash flows are predominantly U.S. dollar denominated, including those of its foreign operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, the Company&#x2019;s foreign subsidiaries have certain assets, liabilities and cash flows that are subject to foreign currency risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the three years ended July 3, 2016, the Company did not utilize derivative instruments to hedge foreign currency risk or for any other purpose.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gains and losses resulting from foreign currency fluctuations are recognized in income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	45
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company values inventories at the lower of cost or market on a first-in, first-out basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company records charges to write-down inventories for unsalable, excess or obsolete raw materials, work-in-process and finished goods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Newly introduced parts are generally not valued until success in the market place has been determined by a consistent pattern of sales and backlog among other factors.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to write-downs based on newly introduced parts, judgmental assessments are calculated for the remaining inventory based on salability, obsolescence, historical experience and current business conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Property, plant and equipment is stated at cost and depreciated using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets, which is generally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years for equipment and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years for buildings.&nbsp;&nbsp;Leasehold improvements are amortized over the shorter of the asset&#x2019;s useful life or the expected term of the lease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation expense for fiscal years 2016, 2015, and 2014 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$49.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$51.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$49.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Goodwill is recorded as the difference, if any, between the aggregate consideration paid for an acquisition and the fair value of the net tangible and intangible assets acquired.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company tests goodwill for impairment at the reporting unit level annually
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or earlier if indicators of potential impairment exist.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on a qualitative assessment, the Company determines if the fair value of a reporting unit is more likely than not to be less than its carrying amount. If potential impairment indicators exist, the Company utilizes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	a two-step quantitative analysis to complete the impairment test.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The first step of the impairment test involves comparing the fair values of the applicable reporting units with their aggregate carrying value using the income approach methodology of valuation. The second step, if necessary, compares the implied fair value of the goodwill with the carrying value of that goodwill.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	goodwill
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	impairment charges have been recorded for any of the periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Intangible assets represent acquired intellectual property and customer relationships and are subject to an annual impairment test.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets are amortized over their estimated useful lives of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years using the straight-line method of amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:16.30%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	63,967&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:16.30%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;

</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	or that the useful life is shorter than originally estimated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Advertising Expense
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company expenses advertising costs in the period in which they occur. Advertising expenses for fiscal years 2016, 2015, and 2014 were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$5.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$5.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	46
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage47"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes revenues when the earnings process is complete, when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, the product has been delivered, the price is fixed and determinable and collection is reasonably assured.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognized approximately 15% of net revenues in fiscal year 2016 from North American (&#x201C;domestic&#x201D;) distributors.&nbsp;&nbsp;Domestic distributor revenues are recognized under agreements which provide for certain sales price rebates and limited product return privileges.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given the uncertainties associated with the levels of pricing rebates, the ultimate sales price on domestic distributor sales transactions is not fixed or determinable until domestic distributors sell the merchandise to the end-customer.&nbsp;&nbsp;Domestic distributor agreements permit the following: price protection on certain domestic distribution inventory if the Company lowers the prices of its products; exchanges up to 5% of certain purchases on a quarterly basis; and ship and debit transactions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Ship and debit transactions occur when the Company agrees to accept a lower selling price for a specific quantity of product at the request of the domestic distributor in order to complete a sales transaction in the domestic distributor channel.&nbsp;&nbsp;For such sales, the Company rebates the negotiated price decrease to the distributor upon shipment as a reduction in the accounts receivable from the distributor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	At the time of shipment to domestic distributors, the Company records a trade receivable and deferred revenue at the distributor&#x2019;s purchase price since there is a legally enforceable obligation from the distributor to pay for the products delivered. The Company relieves inventory as title has passed to the distributor and recognizes deferred cost of sales in the same amount. &#x201C;Deferred income on shipments to distributors&#x201D; represents the difference between deferred revenue and deferred costs of sales and is recognized as a current liability&nbsp;until such time as the distributor confirms a final sale to its end customer.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#x201C;Deferred income on shipments to distributors&#x201D; effectively represents the deferred gross margin on the sale to the distributor; however, the actual amount of gross margin the Company ultimately recognizes in future periods may be less than the originally recorded amount as a result of price protection, negotiated price rebates and exchanges as mentioned above.&nbsp;&nbsp;The wide range and variability of negotiated price rebates granted to distributors does not allow the Company to accurately estimate the portion of the balance in the &#x201C;Deferred income on shipments to distributors&#x201D; that will be remitted back to the distributors.&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal years 2016 and 2015, these price rebates that have been remitted back to distributors have ranged from $3.5 million to $4.4 million per quarter.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company does not reduce deferred income by anticipated future price rebates. Instead, price rebates are recorded against &#x201C;Deferred income on shipments to distributors&#x201D; when incurred, which is generally at the time the distributor sells the product to the end customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s sales to international distributors are made under agreements which permit limited stock return privileges but not sales price rebates.&nbsp;&nbsp;The agreements generally permit distributors to exchange up to 5% of purchases on a semi-annual basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue on international distributor sales is recognized upon shipment at which time title passes.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company estimates international distributor returns based on historical data and current business expectations and defers a portion of international distributor revenues and costs based on these estimated returns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Product Warranty and Indemnification
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s warranty policy provides for the replacement of defective parts.&nbsp;&nbsp;In certain large contracts, the Company has agreed to negotiate in good faith a product warranty in the event that an epidemic failure of its parts was to take place. To date there have been no significant occurrences of epidemic failure.&nbsp;&nbsp;Warranty expense historically has been immaterial.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company provides a limited indemnification for certain customers against intellectual property infringement claims related to the Company&#x2019;s products. In certain cases, there are limits on and exceptions to the Company&#x2019;s potential liability for indemnification relating to intellectual property infringement claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;To date, the Company has not incurred any significant indemnification expenses relating to intellectual property infringement claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company cannot estimate the amount of potential future payments, if any, which the Company might be required to make as a result of these agreements, and accordingly, the Company has not accrued any amounts for its indemnification obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	47
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has equity incentive plans, which are described more fully in &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 2: Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&#x201D;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock-based compensation is measured at the grant date, based on the fair value of the award.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s equity awards granted in fiscal years 2016, 2015, and 2014 were restricted stock awards. Stock-based compensation cost for restricted stock awards is based on the fair market value of the Company&#x2019;s stock on the date of grant.&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock-based compensation cost for stock options is calculated on the date of grant using the fair value of stock options as determined using the Black-Scholes valuation model.&nbsp;The Black-Scholes valuation model requires the Company to estimate key assumptions such as expected option term and stock price volatility to determine the fair value of a stock option.&nbsp;&nbsp;The estimate of these key assumptions is based on historical information and judgment regarding market factors and trends.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company amortizes restricted stock and stock option award compensation cost straight-line over the awards vesting period, which is generally 5 years.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:45PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes a tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognizes liabilities for uncertain tax positions based on the two-step process prescribed in the authoritative accounting literature. The first step is to evaluate the tax position for recognition by determining if the weight of available evidence indicates that it is more likely than not that the position will be sustained on audit, including resolution of related appeals or litigation processes, if any. The second step requires the Company to estimate and measure the tax benefit as the largest amount that is more than 50% likely to be realized upon ultimate settlement.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	See Note
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_448">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for further information
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_449">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related to income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Basic earnings per share is calculated using the weighted average shares of common stock and unvested restricted stock outstanding during the period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Diluted earnings per share is calculated using the weighted average shares of common stock outstanding and unvested restricted stock awards, plus the dilutive effect of stock options and restricted stock units calculated using the treasury stock method, and prior to fiscal year 2015, the dilutive effect of the conversion premium related to the Convertible Senior Notes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The following table sets forth the reconciliation of weighted average common shares outstanding used in the computation of basic and diluted earnings per share:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:17.04%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	543,513&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Adoption of New and Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standard Board (&#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&#x201C;ASU&#x201D;) No. 2014-09 Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606). On July 9, 2015, the FASB agreed to delay the effective date by one year from the first quarter of fiscal year 2018. In accordance with the agreed upon delay, the new standard is effective for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	beginning in the first quarter of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2019. Early adoption is permitted, but not before the original effective date of the standard. The core principle of ASU No. 2014-09 is that a company should recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the company expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU No. 2014-09 provides for one of the two methods of transition: retrospective application to each prior period presented; or recognition of the cumulative effect of retrospective application of the new standard in the period of initial application.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is currently evaluating the impact of ASU No. 2014-09 on its consolidated financial statements and which transition method to elect.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-15, Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern. Each reporting period, management is required to assess whether there is substantial doubt about an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern and if so to provide related footnote disclosures. The new guidance is effective for annual and interim periods ending after December&nbsp;15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted. This ASU is not expected to have an impact on the Company&#x2019;s financial statements or disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-11, Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory. The new guidance changes the measurement principle for inventory from the lower of cost or market to lower of cost and net realizable value.&nbsp;The new guidance is effective for annual and interim periods ending after December&nbsp;15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	intends to implement this guidance beginning in fiscal year 2017.&nbsp;This ASU is not expected to have a material&nbsp;impact on the Company&#x2019;s financial statements or disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-17, Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes.&nbsp;All deferred tax assets and liabilities, along with any related valuation allowance,&nbsp;will&nbsp;be classified as noncurrent on the balance sheet. As a result, each jurisdiction will now only have one net noncurrent deferred tax asset or liability. The new guidance is effective for annual and interim periods ending after December&nbsp;15, 2016.&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted and may be applied either prospectively or retrospectively. The Company adopted this update in the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016 on a prospective basis. Prior reporting periods were not retrospectively adjusted. The adoption of this guidance had no impact on our Consolidated Statements of Income. See Note 10 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, Leases. This standard requires entities that lease assets, with a lease term of more than 12 months, to recognize lease assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet. Under existing guidance, operating leases are not recorded as lease assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet. The standard is effective for fiscal years and the interim periods within those fiscal years beginning after&nbsp;December 15, 2018. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the timing
</FONT>
<A NAME="LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM__CP_TEXT_1_468">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and effects
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of adoption of this ASU on the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09, Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting. This standard will impact how to account for certain aspects of share-based payments to employees.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The standard is effective for
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	fiscal years and the interim periods within those fiscal years beginning after&nbsp;December 15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the timing and effects of adoption of this ASU on the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Equity Incentive Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:203.5PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	currently
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a 2010 Equity Incentive Plan,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	under which the Company may grant Incentive Stock Options, Nonstatutory Stock Options, Stock Appreciation Rights, Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performance Shares and Performance Units.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Prior to its expiration in July 2015, the Company also had a 2005 Equity Incentive Plan, under which it could grant similar awards.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Under the plans, the Company may grant awards to employees, executive officers, directors and consultants who provide services to the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;To date, the Company has only granted Nonstatutory Stock Options, Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units.&nbsp;&nbsp;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million shares were availa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ble for grant under the plans.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s restricted awards generally vest annually over a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	a year) based upon continued employment with the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Options vest over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-year period (generally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	every six months) based upon continued employment.&nbsp;&nbsp; Options expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	seven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years after the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	date of the grant. The Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s last stock option grant to an employee was in January 2009.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	There were no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	outstanding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	as of July 3, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ESPP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) that permits eligible employees to purchase common stock through payroll deductions at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	85%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the fair market value of the common stock at the end of each six-month offering period.&nbsp;&nbsp;The offering periods generally commence on approximately May 1 and November 1 of each year.&nbsp;&nbsp;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million shares were availabl
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e for issuance under the ESPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following is a brief description of each of the Company&#x2019;s equity incentive plans:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2010 Equity Incentive Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2010 Equity Incentive Plan enables the Company to issue Incentive Stock Options, Nonstatutory Stock Options, Stock Appreciation Rights, Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performances Shares and Performance Units.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the 2010 Equity Incentive Plan, the Company may grant awards to employees, executive officers, directors and consultants who provide services to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2005 Equity Incentive Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The 2005 Equity Incentive Plan expired in July 2015. Prior
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its expiration, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he plan enable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company to issue Incentive Stock Options, Nonstatutory Stock Options, Stock Appreciation Rights, Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performances Shares and Performance Units.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the 2005 Equity Incentive Plan, the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	could
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	grant awards to employees, executive officers, directors and consultants who provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	services to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2005 Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2005 E
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	mployee Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	employees of the Company with an opportunity to purchase common stock of the Company through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	accumulated payroll deductions.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The maximum number of shares that may be issued to any one participant in any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-month offering period under the ESPP is currently
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	there was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of total unrecognized stock-based compensation cost related to share-based payments granted under the Company&#x2019;s stock-based compensation plans that will be recognized over a period of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years.&nbsp;&nbsp;Future grants will add to this total, whereas quarterly amortization and the vesting of the existing grants will reduce this total.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company issues new shares of common stock upon exercise of stock options. For the fiscal year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million stock options were exercised for a gain (aggregate intrinsic value) of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million determined as of the date of option exercise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:20.96%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	6,293,108&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.28%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.28%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:20.96%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	41.36&nbsp;

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair Value
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has determined that the only assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and liabilities in the Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s financial statements that are required to be measured at fair value on a recurring basis are the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s investment portfolio assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial instruments are categorized in a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the information used to develop assumptions for measuring fair value and expands disclosures about fair value measurements.&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1 input); then to quoted prices (in non-active markets or in active markets for similar assets or liabilities), inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability, and inputs that are not
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	51
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	directly observable, but that are corroborated by observable market data for the asset or liability (Level 2 input); then the lowest priority to unobservable i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nputs, for example, the Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s data about the assumptions that market participants would use in pricing an asset or liability (Level 3 input).&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair value is a market-based measurement, not an entity-specific measurement, and a fair value measurement should therefore be based on the assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;BACKGROUND-COLOR:YELLOW;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s Level 1 assets consist of investments in money-market funds and United States Treasury securities that are actively traded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s Level 2 assets consist of municipal bonds, obligations of U.S. government-sponsored enterprises, corporate debt and commercial paper that are less actively traded in the market, but where quoted market prices exist for similar instruments that are actively traded.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company determines the fair value of its Level 2 assets by obtaining non-binding market prices from its third-party portfolio managers on the last day of the quarter.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Level 3 assets in fiscal years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following table presents the Company&#x2019;s fair value hierarchy for its financial assets (cash equivalents and marketable securities) measured at fair value on a recurring basis as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:5PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:SUPER;LINE-HEIGHT:120%">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company evaluated the nature of the investments with a loss position at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 28, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which are primarily obligations of the U.S. government and its sponsored enterprises, municipal bonds and U.S. corporate notes.&nbsp;&nbsp;In evaluating the investments, the Company considered the duration of the impairments, and the amount of the impairments relative to the underlying portfolio and concluded that such amounts were not other-than-temporary.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company principally holds securities until maturity, however, they may be sold under certain circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrealized losses on the investments greater than twelve months old were not significant as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	June 28, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<A HREF="#LLTC-20160703X10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;Goodwill and Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On December&nbsp;20, 2011, the Company acquired&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;of the outstanding stock of privately held Dust Networks (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Dust
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) of Hayward, California, a provider of low power wireless sensor network technology.&nbsp;As a result of the acquisition the Company recorded goodwill and intangible assets during fiscal year 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The goodwill balance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	is attributable to the acquisition of Dust.&nbsp;&nbsp;There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	changes to the goodwill balance for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The Company annually evaluates goodwill for impairment as well as whenever events or changes in circumstances might suggest that the carrying value of goodwill may not be recoverable.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company expects that none of the goodwill will be deductible for tax purposes.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Attributable to the acquisition of Dust the Company recorded intangible assets of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$13.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for intellectual property and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$4.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for customer relationships.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reviews intangible assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value of assets may not be recoverable.&nbsp;&nbsp;Finite-intangible assets are amortized on a straight-line basis over their estimated useful lives that is expected to reflect the estimated pattern of economic use.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The remaining amortization expense, related to finite-lived intangible assets, will be recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years.&nbsp; The useful lives of amortizable intangible assets are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets consisted of the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Amortization expense associated with intangible assets for fiscal year

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016

	was

	$2.2
</FONT>

	million,

	$2.2

	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense for intangible assets is estimated to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in fiscal year 2017,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in fiscal year 2018,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in fiscal year 2019,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.2
</FONT>

	million in fiscal year 2020
</FONT>

	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.2

	million in fiscal year 2021

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 6.&nbsp;&nbsp;Convertible Senior Notes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2007, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	billion aggregate principal amount of Convertible Senior Notes (the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Notes paid cash interest ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3.125%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	semiannually.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company used the entire net proceeds of the offering to fund a portion of its repurchase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$3.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	billion of its common stock pursuant to an accelerated stock repurchase transaction.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On May 1, 2014 the Company executed the conversion of the outstanding principal amount of the Notes totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$845.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based upon the conversion price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$40.68
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share, each $1,000 principal amount of the Notes was converted at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	24.582
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the conversion, holders of the Notes received the principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$845.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in cash and the remaining conversion premium was settled in shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock totaling approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;There was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	gain or loss recognized as a result of the conversion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	54
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
